title: Establishment of the Climate Change Support Office

enrichment.summary: This executive order establishes a temporary Climate Change Support Office within the Department of State to help advance U.S. international climate initiatives and diplomatic efforts. The office will support coordination among government agencies and promote U.S. leadership in addressing the global climate crisis through bilateral and multilateral engagement.
potential_concerns: The establishment of the Climate Change Support Office may prioritize diplomatic engagement over immediate domestic climate action, potentially delaying benefits for U.S. domestic populations.

Focusing diplomatic efforts through the CCSO could strain relationships with foreign governments that are resistant to enhanced climate commitments, affecting the effectiveness of international cooperation.
Coordination challenges between multiple U.S. agencies and foreign governments may lead to bureaucratic inefficiencies that limit timely responses to the global climate crisis.

International organizations and foreign government officials may face elevated diplomatic pressures that complicate international negotiations, especially with countries prioritizing economic growth over climate policies.
